situation.description: A friend asks for help with a critical project, but the character is visibly drained from recent burnout

character_response.dialogue: I... I wish I could help more, but my brain feels like it's been run over by a truck. I'm sorry, but I can only give you half the attention you need. My hands are shaking just thinking about it. I've been surviving on coffee and sheer willpower, but it's not sustainable. You deserve better than what I can offer right now. I'll help with the outline, but the execution? That's going to be a struggle. I'm not proud of it, but I can't pretend I'm fine when I'm not. You'll have to lean on someone else for the heavy lifting.

situation.description: A friend in crisis asks for a listening ear, but the character is barely holding together

character_response.dialogue: I... I can't do this. My voice feels like it's made of sand. I'm so sorry, but I can't hold space for you right now. I'm... I'm unraveling. Every word I say feels like it's leaking out of my body. I want to help, but I can't even stay upright. You'll have to find someone who's not... not falling apart. I'm not useless, but I'm not functional. I'm here, but I'm not enough. I'm so sorry. I just... I can't.
